item.title: Trump says US will allow sale of Nvidia H200 AI chips to China
item.description: US President Donald Trump said on Monday that he will allow Nvidia to ship its H200 chips to approved customers in China and other countries, under conditions that allow for continued strong national security. The US Department of Commerce is finalising the details and the same approach will apply to AMD, Intel and other US companies, Trump said in a post on social media. Trump said in the post that he informed Chinese President Xi Jinping of his decision, and that Xi “responded positively”. The...

item.title: NVIDIA Might End the ‘CUDA Moat’ With Its Latest Update, Says Chip Architect Jim Keller, Who Claims It Will Now Be Easier to Port Kernels
item.description:
NVIDIA has introduced one of the biggest upgrades to its CUDA software stack, and the iconic chip architect Jim Keller believes that it might mark the end of the software's exclusivity. NVIDIA's Newest CUDA Update Makes GPU Programming Easier For Everyone It would not be incorrect to say that, so far, with the 'AI frenzy', CUDA has managed to hold everything for NVIDIA when it comes to providing developers with specific libraries and frameworks for creating AI-infused workflows. To the best of our knowledge, no other company has successfully replicated such a software stack. Building upon this, NVIDIA has introduced […]

Read full article at https://wccftech.com/nvidia-might-end-the-cuda-moat-with-its-latest-update-says-jim-keller/

item.title: Global Semiconductor Alliance Presents Annual Awards
item.description:
Last night, the Global Semiconductor Alliance (GSA) celebrated the achievements of remarkable individuals and exceptional semiconductor companies at its annual GSA Awards Ceremony gala. Join us in congratulating this year’s recipients.

Individual Awards:

Dr. Morris Chang Exemplary Leadership Award

• The GSA’s most prestigious award recognizes individuals, such as its namesake, Dr. Morris Chang, for their exceptional contributions to drive the development, innovation, growth, and long-term opportunities for the semiconductor industry. This year’s is recipient Dr. Tsu-Jae King Liu, President, National Academy of Engineering.

Women of Influence Award

• This award recognizes and profiles the next generation of women leaders in the semiconductor industry who are believed to be rising to top executive roles within their organizations. This year’s award was presented to Rong Pan, Corporate Vice President, AMD.

Company Awards:

Most Respected Semiconductor Companies:

GSA members identified the winners in this category by casting ballots for the industry’s most respected companies, judged for their vision, technology and market leadership. This year’s recipients include:

Most Respected Emerging Public Semiconductor Company Award (Achieving $100 to $500 Million in

Annual Sales):

• Lattice Semiconductor

Most Respected Public Semiconductor Company Award (Achieving $500 Million to $1 Billion in Annual Sales)

• Astera Labs

Most Respected Public Semiconductor Company Award (Achieving $1 Billion to $5 Billion in Annual Sales)

• Microchip Technology

Most Respected Public Semiconductor Company Award (Achieving Greater than $5 Billion in Annual Sales)

• NVIDIA

Most Respected Private Semiconductor Company Award

• SiFive

Best Financially Managed Semiconductor Companies:

This award is derived from a broad evaluation of the financial health and performance of public semiconductor companies. This year’s recipients are:

Best Financially Managed Semiconductor Company Award (Achieving Greater than $1 Billion in Annual Sales)

• SK hynix

Best Financially Managed Semiconductor Company Award (Achieving Up to $1 Billion in Annual Sales)

• ASPEED Technology

Start-Up to Watch• GSA’s Private Awards Committee, comprised of successful executives, entrepreneurs and venture capitalists, chose the winner by identifying a promising startup that has demonstrated the potential to positively change its market or the industry through innovation and market application. This year’s winner is Lumotive.

As a global organization, the GSA recognizes outstanding companies headquartered in the Europe/Middle East/Africa (EMEA) and Asia-Pacific regions having a global impact and demonstrating a strong vision, portfolio and market leadership. Two awards were presented in this category:

Outstanding Asia Pacific Semiconductor Company Award

• SK hynix

Outstanding EMEA Semiconductor Company Award

• Infineon Technologies

Analyst Favorite Semiconductor Company

The analyst favorite semiconductor company award was presented based on technology and financial performance, as well as future projections:

• Broadcom was chosen by Jefferies, LLC

The GSA Awards Celebration is the industry’s premier annual event attracting 1700 leaders to celebrate the accomplishments of this industry and honor the best performing companies and top leaders. Each year, the GSA recognizes companies that have demonstrated excellence through their vision, strategy, execution, and future opportunities. The celebration honors the achievements of semiconductor companies in several categories ranging from outstanding leadership to financial accomplishments, as well as overall respect within the industry.

The post Global Semiconductor Alliance Presents Annual Awards appeared first on Semiconductor Digest.

item.title: Grok-5: AGI or battleship Yamato of AI?
item.description:
In August, Elon Musk touted the potential of Grok 5, the namesake AI from the billionaire’s xAI startup. “I think it has a shot at being true AGI. Haven’t felt that about anything before,” he said. He has also claimed “higher intelligence density per gigabyte” than competitors. While definitions of AGI — artificial general intelligence…

The post Grok-5: AGI or battleship Yamato of AI? appeared first on Research & Development World.

item.title: Trump greenlights Nvidia H200 AI chip sales to China, says Xi responded positively
Department of Commerce may approve Nvidia H200 chip exports to China
item.description: This news comes as a bill was introduced in Congress last week to prevent these exact kinds of chip exports.
